-(s)i.definition: make noun plural, si is used when word ends in a vowel otherwise i

-al.definition: indicating repetition or continuation of a verb

-er.definition: "something or one who does" verb. -an/-en verbs drop -an/-en, vowel-ending just add -r

-fald.definition: consisting of so many parts, attached to numbers; (idiomatically unfald=simple)

-fum.definition: "place"; the 'place' where something is done or occurs

-ian.definition: verb from noun/adjective in the sense of "to be X", to noun-en

-ira.definition: diminutive; added to indicate small size, young age, affection, or cuteness

-koun.definition: English equivalent 'able' from 'kounen', denotes attached word is possible

-kraft.definition: the craft, skill, or trade of the affixed

-lefar.definition: agent suffix, believer in some kind of system

-les.definition: -less, adj. comparative (rathles = less red); false, fakse, psuedo

-min.definition: -least; adjective superlative (goth = good, gothmin = least good)

-om.definition: group, organization, or (abstractly) fighting force, militia

-r.definition: "something or one who does" verb. -an/-en verbs drop -an/-en, vowel-ending just add -r

-rom.definition: room,booth, or small enclosure where something occurs

-the.definition: turns a noun into an adjective and numbers into ordinal numbers

-ung.definition: "-tion"; "-ment"; noun meaning result of word happening or carried out (e.g. discovery, establishment, admonition)

-vul.definition: "-ful", full of, tending to, adjective possessing a quality related to the noun
